#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk pam_pkcs11
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: pam_pkcs11 bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The pam_pkcs11 packages allow the X.509 certificate-based user authentication. The packages provide access to the certificate and its dedicated private key with an appropriate Public Key Cryptographic Standards #11 (PKCS#11) module. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the spec file for the pam_pkcs11 packages contained flags that were obsolete or made certain parts of the code ineffective. With this update, the mentioned flags have been removed from the spec file. (BZ#1037725) Prior to this update, the pam_pkcs11 packages in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 were missing two bug fixes present in pam_pkcs11 for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6. They were the bug fix for BZ#586422, which fixed argument parsing for the pam_pkcs11 module, and the bug fix for BZ#625509, which updated pam_pkcs11 to no longer display error messages when certain expected errors occurred. This update adds the fixes for the mentioned bugs also for pam_pkcs11 in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. (BZ#1039221) Previously, pam_pkcs11 required the module path name contained in the security module database and the path name to the same module in the pam_pkcs11.conf file to be identical and did not correctly handle configurations with two equivalent but differently phrased path names, such as one path name containing the "lib64/" directory and the other path name containing the "$LIB" variable. As a consequence, pam_pkcs11 denied access to users authenticating with a smart card when the mentioned path names were not phrased identically. With this update, the process through which pam_pkcs11 compares the path names has been modified, and users can now authenticate themselves using a smart card as expected. (BZ#1061222) Users of pam_pkcs11 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
